title: Has Joe Biden chosen a running mate for Vice President? - Quora
tags: Vice President of the United States
Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I think this story is the perfect segway into my answer. It captures the whole concept in one photo. Meghan McCain on Who Joe Biden Should and Shouldn't Pick for His VP  (Credit: ET Online | Yes she’s sitting on his lap!) I highly recommend you read this article. Not just because of how well its written and the timing of it, but she’s thinking “Tammy Duckworth”.  If the highly connected, politically savvy Megan points in Tammy’s direction, the likelihood that Biden’s handlers are going in her direction is a smart guess, better than the other candidates. Why is this endorsement significant? Because the establishment who actually tells Biden what to do, desperately needs to be back in control of the White House. So how do they get that done? Think about it… Biden’s handlers know everything rides on their VP pick. They are torn between find a competent person who will follow orders and a person who has some novelty in a victim class. Tammy is a good choice, but they run the risk of her going rogue. She’s smart. She has her own mind. She’s got grit and determination that would be impossible to control. If they pick her, then she’s the first woman President, on Biden’s improbable win. Which leads me to my answer. No, Biden hasn’t picked his running mate, yet. But his handlers have. They are just trying to get it so that she’s the second bitter pill everyone has to swallow. Why Biden’s Smart to Take His Time With His Veep Pick Think about it. They must find a person willing to cover up for their crimes. The establishment can’t afford Trump four more years and both houses. They put all their cards into stacking this deck! Megan said she can’t see Susan Rice, because she’s never held public office. If that was the criteria, then she’s right, on it’s face, but Megan can’t see the main objective. Susan Rice is already their choice, because she’s the only one trusted to cover up all of the Obama administration’s secrets. She’s the only one who can be “handled”. Megan’s anti-endorsement of Susan Rice, is actually the signal to everyone else that Susan Rice is exactly who they’re going to pick. Disclaimer: IF I’m wrong, I’m wrong and I will breath a sigh of relief, right along side everyone else. However, know this: The Democrats got themselves in a PICKLE. If Biden is elected, then the VP WILL be the first woman President. A distinction they promised to Hillary Clinton, but failed to deliver. To have the FIRST woman President has to be more “storied” than the first minority President. They can’t find a hand puppet for that job. She will feel empowered and the press will HAVE to look the other way. The establishment ABSOLUTELY needs to pick a woman they can CONTROL and that’s how EFFED up Biden made things for them.

VP running mates are chosen to “balance” the ticket. This means that they are chosen to shore up their perceived weaknesses. Obama picked Biden because he was looking for a moderate white guy to ensure whites he wasn’t a radical. There was no love and no common belief between the two men. It was just a deal. By the same token, Trump knew he need the evangelicals. With his position on abortion he had a good chance to lock them up. By picking Pence he was trying to lock that vote in place. Again, Trump and Pence weren’t buddy buddy. It was a political deal. Biden (or his advisors) looks at the electorate and realize that the democrats are loosing the white vote more and more every year. HRC only got 34%. He desperately needs the turnout of black vote that Obama got and he needs 90%+ of it. He feels a black women can deliver that. Whether he is right or not is something we shall see.

He may have. He may not have. Choosing this person is one thing. Notifying this person, to ensure they wish to accept this appointment, is a different thing. Publicly announcing it, is a completely different thing. In other words, nobody here can answer your question. Not yet. Nobody here can answer your question.

He is having them professionally vetted {unlike leader trump who seems to grab people off fox at random} and then meet with them one on one most likely at a distance so as not to fuel the childish speculations. Then he will decide.
Not yet. His handlers are trying to find someone whose image hasn’t been tarnished in the run up debates. Remember that many VPs, Truman for instance, are someone only locals have ever heard of.

First his party is not going to let him choose anything. When the party deals are completed they may allow him to make the announcement. The party will be making all his choices including if there is a debate or not.
